intro: Senecio hoppeanus, commonly known as the Hoppe's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio hoppeanus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
